get.summary: Returns a list of warehouses from the specified workspace.
get.description:
This API supports [pagination](/rest/api/fabric/articles/pagination).

## Permissions

The caller must have a *viewer* workspace role.

## Required Delegated Scopes

Workspace.Read.All or Workspace.ReadWrite.All

## Microsoft Entra supported identities

This API supports the Microsoft [identities](/rest/api/fabric/articles/identity-support) listed in this section.

| Identity | Support |
|-|-|
| User | Yes |
| [Service principal](/entra/identity-platform/app-objects-and-service-principals#service-principal-object) and [Managed identities](/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) | Yes |

## Interface

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: A token for retrieving the next page of results.

default.description:
Common error codes:

* InvalidItemType - Invalid item type.

post.summary: Creates a warehouse in the specified workspace.
post.description:
This API supports [long running operations (LRO)](/rest/api/fabric/articles/long-running-operation).

 This API does not support create a warehouse with definition. 

## Permissions

The caller must have a *contributor* workspace role.

## Required Delegated Scopes

 Warehouse.ReadWrite.All or Item.ReadWrite.All 

## Limitations 
- To create a warehouse the workspace must be on a supported Fabric capacity. For more information see: [Microsoft Fabric license types](/fabric/enterprise/licenses#microsoft-fabric-license-types).

## Microsoft Entra supported identities

This API supports the Microsoft [identities](/rest/api/fabric/articles/identity-support) listed in this section.

| Identity | Support |
|-|-|
| User | Yes |
| [Service principal](/entra/identity-platform/app-objects-and-service-principals#service-principal-object) and [Managed identities](/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) | Yes |

## Interface

202.description: Request accepted, warehouse provisioning in progress.

Location.description: The URL of the operation status, which can be used to track the operation state.

x-ms-operation-id.description: The operation ID which can be used with long running operations (LRO) APIs to track the operation state and get the result.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request.

default.description:
Common error codes:

* InvalidItemType - Item type is invalid.

* ItemDisplayNameAlreadyInUse - Item display name is already used.

* CorruptedPayload - The provided payload is corrupted.

* WorkspaceItemsLimitExceeded - Workspace item limit exceeded.

get.summary: Returns the SQL connection string of the specified warehouse.
get.description:
## Permissions

 The caller must have *read* permissions for the warehouse. The caller must have *viewer* or higher workspace role. 

## Required Delegated Scopes

 Warehouse.Read.All or Warehouse.ReadWrite.All or Item.Read.All or Item.ReadWrite.All

## Microsoft Entra supported identities

This API supports the Microsoft [identities](/rest/api/fabric/articles/identity-support) listed in this section.

| Identity | Support |
|-|-|
| User | Yes |
| [Service principal](/entra/identity-platform/app-objects-and-service-principals#service-principal-object) and [Managed identities](/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) | Yes |

## Interface

parameters.name: guestTenantId
parameters.description: The guest tenant ID if the end user's tenant is different from the warehouse tenant.

parameters.name: privateLinkType
parameters.description: Indicates the type of private link this connection string uses. Additional `privateLinkType` types may be added over time.

default.description:
Common error codes:

* ItemNotFound - The requested item was not found. 

* InvalidGuestTenantId - The provided guest tenant ID does not exist.

post.summary: Creates a restore point for a warehouse at the current timestamp.
post.description:
This API supports [long running operations (LRO)](/rest/api/fabric/articles/long-running-operation). 

 ## Permissions

 The caller must have *write* warehouse permission. 

## Required Delegated Scopes

Warehouse.ReadWrite.All or Item.ReadWrite.All

## Limitations

Warehouse deletes both the system-created and user-defined restore point at the expiry of the 30 calendar day retention period.

A restore point cannot be created if there is already a restore point creation already in-progress or during warehouse creation, deletion or rename.

## Microsoft Entra supported identities

This API supports the Microsoft [identities](/rest/api/fabric/articles/identity-support) listed in this section.

| Identity | Support |
|-|-|
| User | Yes |
| [Service principal](/entra/identity-platform/app-objects-and-service-principals#service-principal-object) and [Managed identities](/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) | Yes |

## Interface

202.description: Request accepted, restore point creation in progress.

Location.description: The URL of the operation status, which can be used to track the operation state.

x-ms-operation-id.description: The operation ID which can be used with long running operations (LRO) APIs to track the operation state and get the result.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request.

default.description:
Common error codes:

* RestorePointCreationAlreadyInProgress - A restore point creation is already in-progress.

get.summary: Returns the properties of a restore point specified for a warehouse.
get.description:
## Permissions

 The caller must have *read* or *write* warehouse permission. 

## Required Delegated Scopes

Warehouse.Read.All or Warehouse.ReadWrite.All or Item.Read.All or Item.ReadWrite.All

## Interface

default.description:
Common error codes:

* RestorePointNotFound - The requested restore point does not exist, or the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions for this operation.

delete.summary: Deletes a restore point specified for a warehouse.
delete.description:
## Permissions

 The caller must have *write* warehouse permission. 

## Required Delegated Scopes

Warehouse.ReadWrite.All or Item.ReadWrite.Alll

## Limitations

You can delete user-defined restore points, but system-created restore points cannot be deleted.

## Microsoft Entra supported identities

This API supports the Microsoft [identities](/rest/api/fabric/articles/identity-support) listed in this section.

| Identity | Support |
|-|-|
| User | Yes |
| [Service principal](/entra/identity-platform/app-objects-and-service-principals#service-principal-object) and [Managed identities](/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) | Yes |

## Interface

default.description:
Common error codes:

* RestorePointNotFound - The requested restore point does not exist, or the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions for this operation. 

* CannotDeleteAutomaticRestorePointException - System generated restore points cannot be deleted.

 The caller must have *write* warehouse permission.

post.summary: Restores a warehouse in-place to the restore point specified.
post.description:
This API supports [long running operations (LRO)](/rest/api/fabric/articles/long-running-operation). 

 ## Permissions

 The caller must have *restore* warehouse permission. 

## Required Delegated Scopes

Warehouse.Restore.All

## Limitations

A restore point cannot be restored if there is another restore point restoration already in-progress.

## Microsoft Entra supported identities

This API supports the Microsoft [identities](/rest/api/fabric/articles/identity-support) listed in this section.

| Identity | Support |
|-|-|
| User | Yes |
| [Service principal](/entra/identity-platform/app-objects-and-service-principals#service-principal-object) and [Managed identities](/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/overview) | Yes |

## Interface

202.description: Request accepted, restore point restoration in progress.

Location.description: The URL of the operation status, which can be used to track the operation state.

x-ms-operation-id.description: The operation ID which can be used with long running operations (LRO) APIs to track the operation state and get the result.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request.

default.description:
Common error codes:

* RestorePointNotFound - The requested restore point does not exist, or the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions for this operation. 

* RestorePointRestorationAlreadyInProgress - A restore point restoration is already in-progress.
